title: New Army regulation lifts the ban on dreadlocks | Daily Mail Online
text: Black women celebrate new Army regulation lifting the ban on dreadlocks Critics complained the Army's rules placed unfair burden on black women New directive on appearance standards was published in January 2017 They finally lifted the ban on 'dreadlocks/locks', which is the easiest style to maintain among the permitted twists, braids and cornrows Black women in the military rejoiced, expressing their relief and excitement Nikky Nwamokobia teamed up with First Lt. Whennah Andrews of the National Guard to create video breaking down the misconceptions around locks She said chemical relaxers or using straightening irons were either time consuming or expensive, not to mention damaging to hair Published: 19:45 GMT, 10 February 2017 | Updated: 22:20 GMT, 10 February 2017 483 shares
